icap.services.resources.gs
Class JavaSpoonScript

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      icap.services.resources.gs.SpoonScript
          icap.services.resources.gs.JavaSpoonScript
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, HttpConstants
public class JavaSpoonScript
extends SpoonScript

Extension of GreasySpoon script, in order to support direct Java coding without JSR223 overhead
Scripts must conform to NativeScript skeleton and are compiled and loaded in memory Compiled result is stored on disk but is more or less useless TODO: check if scripts are correctly unloaded from memory after deletion TODO: check if writing compiled class on disk has an interest or working in memory can be enough

Author:
Karel MITTIG

Constructor Detail

JavaSpoonScript

public JavaSpoonScript(Icap.TYPE icapmode)
Create a new GreasySpoon Script object with its associated script engine.
The script engine is initialized when loading script from disk (as it requires the file extension to instantiate the associated engine.

Parameters:
icapmode - The mode in which this script is running (REQMOD/RESPMOD)
